channel.title: How slow is reflection?
channel.description: How much slower is reflection than simply calling a method in client? I don't want to use method injection any longer, because, if Jagex wanted to make it so(saving a few bytes of space along the way), method injection could easily become as detectable as a deob.

item.title: How slow is reflection?
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

I’ve actually wanted to know that, but never was bother to test and I always just ran conventional methods.

Read full topic

item.title: How slow is reflection?
item.dc:creator: @Iamadam Iamadam
item.description:
@Iamadam wrote:

[me=Iamadam]runs some quick tests.[/me]

Normal method call: 156 ms
Interface method call: 250 ms
Reflection field access: 103200 ms

The figures represent the amount of time it took to complete 10 million operations on an AMD 4600+.

Reflection field access grabs the field and then gets the value of it.

Field f = someClassClass.getDeclaredField("someStaticInt"); Object o = f.get(someClass);

With only the second part being executed, it is considerably faster:

Modified reflection field access: 11250 ms

But it is still much slower than conventional methods. Keep in mind that these tests aren’t the most accurate, but they do give you a fairly good general idea.

Read full topic
